column5: You should try Obabikon Lake crappies in September... crazy fun fishing on LOTW's that time of year.
Going to an Island camp on Lake Minnitaki. This will be our 3rd year at this cabin. We will be arriving just in time for the Rice River and English River sanctuaries to open. C'mon walleyes.
Second week of June (8-14) Staying at Agimak Lake Resort in Ignace (have been for 8 years). Will be fishing Kukukus, Barrel, Indian, Flat Rock, and Arethusa.
Lac Des Mille in June Winnipeg River in July LOTW Sabaskong in Aug. LOTW Whitfish Bay in Oct. Still looking for Sept.
Second week of June Northwest Lac Seul.
Our group always goes last week of july. We stay on Eagle Lake at the South Shore Lodge. This will be our 6th year.

July 4 thru 11, Onaway Lodge Lac Seul, 11 1/2 weeks to go, then I am going to look up Rose and check out her camp and see about bringing my grandson up in Mid-Aug. My wife is going to Jamaica, I go to Canada, S W E E T !
Leaving in 58 days 23 hours and 48 minutes (June 13th). We're heading up to the Sioux Lookout area. We'll stay on Minnitaki but also spend a couple of days on Lac Suel.
Nungesser Lake July 5 Cant Wait
Heading to Grassy Narrows Camp on 6/7. Would enjoy chatting with anyone else heading up to the Miles Bay area.

Pike50plus; I have seen some of your posts and I would like to get your feeback on how you did at Campbell Lake in July. Our group is mainly made up of guys who are die-hard walleye nuts. One guy though is really interested in having a chance to catch some large (40"+) Northern's.. I know there are some great northern lakes out there (Wollaston,Lake Athabasa, Gods Lake etc)but they are a bit out of our price range.. Would really appreciate your report after the trip. Thanks; Gene Theisen

This year it was Eagle for the opener (had good fihing) Gullrock early August and Lac Seul in September. We also play a little golf in Red Lake and Ear Falls with our August and September trips. Pretty tough to beat!
Going to Gold Pines camp near Ear Falls, first 2 weeks of July with the wife and last week of August with three other fellas from work.

Red Lake June 8-14th Bow Narrows never been there hope its good. Need ideas and help we usually go up in late July-August. 65 days and counting just booked it. Gettin excited about hopefully havin some great pike fishin.
Lower manitou first and last week of June. Can't wait Great bass lakers and muskies after the opener
June 10th thru the 14th at Golden Eagle Resort on Lac Seul.
We will be out of Nakina for our 7th year with Leuenbergers for a week in mid june.
First week of July, Evergreen Lodge on Lac Seul, been going for 18 years. Wore out two vehicles and one boat. Hope to wear out a couple more of each.

Grass River Lodge, Reed Lake, Manitoba Enjoyed talking to the owners at the Sportshow. Have buyers remorse about 16 hr drive from Mpls to Northern Manitoba, and $5.50/gal Canadian gas....BUT cost is only a little more than what I would have paid somewhere else, and it will be my first really remote Canadian trip, with fly out fishing to boot, and it will the furthest north I am ever likely to go, and it will be an adventure, and - will gas ever get cheaper??? - excited about lots of pike, lots of walleye, and the northern lights.

Grass River Lodge, Reed Lake, Manitoba Enjoyed talking to the owners at the Sportshow. Have buyers remorse about 16 hr drive from Mpls to Northern Manitoba, and $5.50/gal Canadian gas....BUT cost is only a little more than what I would have paid somewhere else, and it will be my first really remote Canadian trip, with fly out fishing to boot, and it will the furthest north I am ever likely to go, and it will be an adventure, and - will gas ever get cheaper??? - excited about lots of pike, lots of walleye, and the northern lights.

Halleys Camp, Caribou Falls Landing, on Umfreville Lake. http://halleyscamps.com/ Leaving the second week of June. I think this is my 11th year. We take 3 motorhomes and 5-6 boats. Camping is primitive, but there are hot showers and thats all we need! Its about a 600 miles, or 12 hours by motorhome. Always have a great time with the Kemp's from Waseca and the cities! Erik
Going to Lac La Marte fist trip there hoping for some trophy pike.NWT north west of Yellowknife Alanta Dave
minnesota,can't afford canada anymore
We will be on Eagle this year. May for the walleye opener. A week in early July for Musky, and three weeks at the end of July early August for musky and walleye. Counting the days.

Minnitaki for Memorial Day weekend for a total of 7 days. Wanted to get back to the Red for the October walleye run, but my other half decided to get pregnant and be due on the 10th. Do you think she would understand? It is our third after all and I was there for the first two:rotfl: Greenbacks....or third child? Just kidding. There is always next year!!!
lake evans, quebec. kirk island camp the last week of june. being run by a new outfitter and we are anxious to see upgrades and get back on the lake.
Yes fished with him before great pike fishing!

South Bay at Gullrock........August 7 until the weather goes to ####. Could be an entire month or more! We used to go in early June but now do a family deal with Grandkids so moved it to warmer weather. ####, the fish don't care. We caught lots of very nice 20-25's last September.
Gullrock for me - Last week of June. Poplar Point Resort. Been going there for almost 15 years. CanÂ´t wait to meet the new owners. :cheers:
8 pound small mouth on a reg basis... I know fishermen can "stretch" the truth.

Mark: I am an American. The charitable auction is for LESA, the Lutheran Elementary School Association, and the auction is tonight. I don't know of any "deals" like mine, but I would suggest calling or checking on-line with real estate brokers in the areas you want to fish. They frequently rent properties for owners, or have them to rent themselves. Other than that, start asking around town where you fish, someone might know something. That's how my wife found this place. The Mayor's wife showed it to her. Lucky break for me. It's been about 8 years or so that I have been in this house.
Two weeks in July to LOTW just north of Sioux Narrows, Laughing Water Campground. Bellbuoy
Gullrock Lake - May 31 to June 7 - Five Lakes Lodge. I think it is our 8 trip and I'm just as excited as the first trip, can't wait.
Hey Brad: I live in Nestor Falls for 4 months each year. I started coming here in 1953. Long time ago for sure.

It's pretty expensive the way I do it. I rent a 3 bedroom/2 bath house right on the water. I rent it by the season and we close it down when I leave. It runs about $18,000 for the 4 months. Included is a boat dock, satellite tv and phone service. I have use of a boat house that sleeps 8 and is air conditioned. I spend around $4,200 per season in gas for the boat. All in all, I guess it costs me around $26,500 per year to be there. That comes out to about $225 per day. I have lots of company and donate a week all expenses trip for two to my cottage including air fare, guiding, license, bait, food, beverages, etc. to a charitable auction each year. It went for $3,300 last year. Let me know if you want to bid. LOL

It must get expensive, with gas prices and the cost of everything going up. I am very lucky to live in northwestern ontario. I go out every chance I can get. I fish Lac Seul, Wabigoon, and Eagle Lake, alot. But there are some smaller lakes in the area, with access by logging roads, that have Dynamite fishing. I mainly fish for walleye, but when I guide canoe trips to White Otter Castle on the Turtle river system, I know places where 4-8 lb smallmouth bass are caught at a regular basis. Can't wait for the ice to break and to be out there in my boats and canoe. Hope to see you on the water.

Manitoba, Dunlops (use to be little Churchill) at their Campbell Lake outpost camphttp://www.dunlopfishing.com/content/view/53/1/ First week of June 28 to July 5 and catfishing the Winnipeg river the sunday after coming out
White Pines Lodge LOTW - 1st timer. June 21-27....Can't wait...

Hey Bob Pieski, What charity do you donate the money to? It sounds like a good deal. Are you american or canadian, I would like to rent a place for the season but being down here in the states I havn't found an opportunity like yours. Do you have any suggestions?
Flayers out of Ignace,3rd week of June.My wife is going to Las Vegas,I hope she has fun. Terry
Two weeks in June and September at Nestor Falls. One week fly in from Minaki in July. I wish I could stay all summer but I still work 3 days a week.
July at O'Sullivans Rainbow at O'Sullivans Lake near Nakina for walleyes; mid-September at Youngs, Nestor Falls, LOW for crappies and walleyes.
Nushagak River, AK. Last week of June. I hope to get to SK in September. :)

We are going to lac Seul the second week of June and the first week of July and the first week of September. Been doing this for 10 years and the fishing is always great. Gives us a chance to follow the Walleyes from post spawn to deep water.
May 15th to Lake of the Woods. Return around Sept. 15th. Life is good.
Bay of Quinte middle of May for a week. This will be our 30th year in a row.
West end, Lac Seul, last week of July

Hey Bob, I do not want to get prsonal and you do not have to answer but I assume you are retired. How much does it cost you to be up at a camp for 4 months or do you have your own place? We leave Sept. 9th for wrights on gullrock. Been going up to canada for 29 years and I am 36--started young!!!
Heading to Chamberlain Narrows area, Lac Seul, for 10 days starting May 29. Started going in 1982. Getting pricey, but we HAVE TO go!
Lac Seul, end of July. Will be my 7th trip to LacSeul.

Bob, if you don't mind me asking, what part of LOTW do you stay on? I have a cabin out of Sioux Narrows-Lobstick bay. I only get to go a week here and there. Someday......I would like to think I can stay the whole summer. Brad

We'll be going to Sleepy Dog for the 3rd year in a row on the second week of June, prior to that we went to Florence Lake in Perrault falls since 1983. Have fished the Lac Seul, Perrault, Wabaskang, Wine Lake, Zizania, Wapesi, Broad, Sunlight, Glider, Lost Lake, Vaughn Lake, Anishinabi, and a few other I can't remember. My parents were outfitters in the 80's around Perrault Falls. It's like a second home to me. My brother and I are taking our boys for the first time this year. They'll be 4th generation Candian fishermen!
Cedar Lake Lodge in Perrault Falls on June 7th..this will be our 22nd year going there
